snippet: A coastal slice of Japan near Osaka used to be called Panel Bay because of the factories making sophisticated flat-panel screens - symbols of Japan's manufacturing prowess. In recent months, many of those plants have been closed or partially sold...
abstract: A coastal slice of Japan near Osaka used to be called Panel Bay because of the factories making sophisticated flat-panel screens - symbols of Japan's manufacturing prowess. In recent months, many of those plants have been closed or partially sold off, as the once seemingly invincible electronics industry has lost out to Chinese and South Korean challengers.The demise of Panel Bay is the latest sign of what many Japanese fear is now the "deindustrialization" of their manufacturing economy.

headline.main: Declining as a Manufacturer, Japan Weighs Reinvention
